intro: Bupleurum gracile, commonly known as slender valerian, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained, loamy soils in full sun to partial shade. Its roots are often harvested for medicinal purposes, containing compounds with potential anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties.
